text: Given that you want to create a GUI it might be a lot easier to create a web app with a python server behind it, even factoring in that you’d have to additionally learn html/css + javascript + a js framework (you could see this as a single skill).

elements.text: Given that you want to create a GUI it might be a lot easier to create a web app with a python server behind it, even factoring in that you’d have to additionally learn html/css + javascript + a js framework (you could see this as a single skill).

text: Also, seems like a terribly ambitious first programming project. You will create beginner programming patterns and have to work with those for the rest of the project if you don’t restart from scratch. Might as well make your mistakes on some other project?

elements.text: Also, seems like a terribly ambitious first programming project. You will create beginner programming patterns and have to work with those for the rest of the project if you don’t restart from scratch. Might as well make your mistakes on some other project?

text: +1, in terms of your CV getting experience in a full stack web app is very valuable, using python only to write a GUI will probably kill you

elements.text: +1, in terms of your CV getting experience in a full stack web app is very valuable, using python only to write a GUI will probably kill you

text: Before you make a big application you have <https://www.ic.unicamp.br/~meidanis/courses/mc336/2009s2/prolog/problemas/|99> other problems to <https://wiki.python.org/moin/ProblemSets/99%20Prolog%20Problems%20Solutions|consider>. I’d say if the first ~30 make you pause then you’re not ready for a project.

text:
Jeff, writing software is 10% writing code and 90%:

• thinking of how to structure things
• researching things you don’t know
• figuring out things by experimenting
• banging your head against the wall because of one tiny thing that it’s so obvious and why the f**k doesn’t it work, I mean it’s supposed to work if I write it like this… then realising it just needed a little tweak and the programming language is not stupid, but you are
So, don’t be discouraged if you can’t figure things out in 1 hour

elements.text: Jeff, writing software is 10% writing code and 90%:
thinking of how to structure things
researching things you don’t know
figuring out things by experimenting

banging your head against the wall because of one tiny thing that it’s so obvious and why the f**k doesn’t it work, I mean it’s supposed to work if I write it like this… then realising it just needed a little tweak and the programming language is not stupid, but you are
So, don’t be discouraged if you can’t figure things out in 1 hour

text: I'm very much an amateur still but have managed to put together an app over the course of a few months using this library and a few others, that does a fair amount of different things, it's probably still pretty basic for people here, but figure out a scaled back version of your end goal and start with that, then build up on top of that I would say, I was in a similar boat of not being able to learn following video's etc. because they weren't necessarily what I was aiming to do and no matter how many times I read about dictionaries, lists, functions I couldn't get my head around it, but now I understand and use them all through repitition and needing to know what they are to push my app forward

elements.text: I'm very much an amateur still but have managed to put together an app over the course of a few months using this library and a few others, that does a fair amount of different things, it's probably still pretty basic for people here, but figure out a scaled back version of your end goal and start with that, then build up on top of that I would say, I was in a similar boat of not being able to learn following video's etc. because they weren't necessarily what I was aiming to do and no matter how many times I read about dictionaries, lists, functions I couldn't get my head around it, but now I understand and use them all through repitition and needing to know what they are to push my app forward
